articles.description: Newcastle United knocked out of the Champions League after losing to AC Milan as Eddie Howe's side finish bottom of Group F and drop out of European competition
articles.title: Newcastle out of Champions League after Milan loss

articles.description: From the moment she was named, Aitana Bonmati has stood out from the rest and stood up for something more than herself.
articles.title: 'She was like a tsunami' - the unstoppable rise of Bonmati

articles.description: Paris St-Germain reach the Champions League knockout phase after 17-year-old Warren Zaire-Emery's goal earned a priceless draw at Borussia Dortmund.
articles.title: PSG scrape through to Champions League last 16

articles.description: Thomas Bach says Ukraine is "one war among 28 wars and conflicts going on this world".
articles.title: Paris 2024 Olympics: IOC boss defends move to allow Russians and Belarusians to compete as neutrals

articles.description: Royal Antwerp stun Barcelona for their first ever Champions League win in a thrilling match in Group H at the Bosuilstadion, featuring two goals in stoppage time.
articles.title: Royal Antwerp score late winner to stun Barcelona

articles.description: LIV Golf chief executive Greg Norman says Jon Rahm's decision to join the Saudi-funded circuit will create a "domino effect".
articles.title: Rahm's LIV move will make 'more apples fall' - Norman

articles.description: Micah Hamilton scores on his Manchester City debut to help his side beat Red Star Belgrade and reach the Champions League last 16 with a 100% record.
articles.title: Hamilton scores on debut as Man City beat Red Star

articles.description: Red Bull team principal Christian Horner says he doubts his team's outstanding 2023 Formula 1 season will be repeated in his lifetime.
articles.title: Red Bull's 2023 season unlikely to be repeated - Horner

articles.description: Manchester United's Champions League campaign proves "they do not belong in this elite company", writes Phil McNulty.
articles.title: How Man Utd's worst-ever Champions League campaign ended in 'shambles'

articles.description: Gustaf Lagerbielke's injury-time header delivers Celtic's first Champions League win at home in 10 years with a spirited victory against Feyenoord to conclude their disappointing campaign.
articles.title: Celtic earn dramatic win to end 10-year home wait
